prompt:
Write Python code that defines the following pandas DataFrame:

import pandas as pd
data = {
    "UserID": ["User1", "User2", "User3", "User4", "User5", "User6"],
    "SessionDurationMinutes": [15, 25, 10, 30, 22, 18],
    "PagesViewed": [5, 8, 3, 10, 7, 6],
    "DeviceType": ["Desktop", "Mobile", "Desktop", "Mobile", "Desktop", "Mobile"],
    "Converted": [True, False, False, True, True, False]
}
df = pd.DataFrame(data)

After creating the DataFrame, prepare the data for a classification model to predict the "Converted" status. The code should: 1) Create a new numerical feature "DeviceType_Numeric" by mapping "Desktop" to 0 and "Mobile" to 1. 2) Create another new feature "PagesPerMinute" calculated as "PagesViewed" / "SessionDurationMinutes". Handle any potential division by zero by replacing resulting NaNs or Infs with 0. 3) Select "SessionDurationMinutes", "PagesViewed", "DeviceType_Numeric", and "PagesPerMinute" as the feature set. 4) Print the head of this new feature DataFrame. Provide only Python code.
evaluation_criteria: Code should correctly define the DataFrame, create "DeviceType_Numeric" and "PagesPerMinute" features as specified (including handling division by zero for the latter), select the correct final features, and print the head of the resulting DataFrame.
